slp.label: Load Profile
slp.help: Standard load profile (SLP) describing the annual electricity consumption pattern at the site. Different profiles (H0, G0-G7, L0-L2) represent various consumption patterns (households, commercial, agriculture). The profile determines the temporal distribution of consumption throughout the year.

consumption.label: Annual Consumption
consumption.help: Total annual electricity consumption of the site in MWh. Used together with the load profile to scale the temporal pattern of electricity demand. This value corresponds to the base consumption without fleet charging.

existing.label: Existing
existing.help: Existing grid connection capacity in kW. This capacity is available in the baseline scenario and limits the maximum power that can be drawn from the grid simultaneously.

expansion.label: Additional
expansion.help: Additional grid connection capacity in kW added in the expansion scenario. Increases the maximum power that can be drawn from the grid. Added to existing capacities and enables higher peak loads.

existing.label: Existing
existing.help: Existing installed capacity of the photovoltaic system in kWp. This capacity is available in the baseline scenario. Actual generation depends on solar irradiance at the site location (based on coordinates).

expansion.label: Additional
expansion.help: Additional installed PV capacity in kWp added in the expansion scenario. Increases local electricity generation and can improve self-consumption. Excess energy can be fed into the grid or stored in the battery.

existing.label: Existing
existing.help: Existing storage capacity of the stationary battery system in kWh. This capacity is available in the baseline scenario. The storage can buffer PV surplus and discharge when needed.

expansion.label: Additional
expansion.help: Additional storage capacity in kWh added in the expansion scenario. Enables better utilization of PV generation and peak shaving. Larger storage systems can buffer more energy and reduce grid load.

discount.label: Capital cost rate
discount.help: Interest rate in percent for discounting future cash flows. Typical values: 3-7%. Higher values reduce the present value of future investments more strongly. Used for calculating Net Present Cost (NPC).

fixcost.label: Fix Expansion Costs
fixcost.help: One-time fixed costs in EUR for site expansion in the expansion scenario (e.g., planning, permits, infrastructure preparation, earthworks). Only considered in the expansion scenario and accounted as CAPEX in the first year.

opexbuy.label: Energy tariff
opexbuy.help: Costs for purchasing electricity from the grid in EUR/kWh. Multiplied by the purchased energy amount and accounted as operating costs (OPEX). Typically includes energy price, grid fees, and taxes.

opexfeedin.label: Feed-in tariff renewable
opexfeedin.help: Compensation for feeding excess PV electricity into the grid in EUR/kWh. Negative values mean costs (e.g., grid fees for feed-in), positive values mean revenue. Multiplied by the fed-in energy amount.

opexpeakpower.label: Power tariff
opexpeakpower.help: Costs for maximum power demand (power price) in EUR/kW. Calculated based on the highest peak load in the year and accounted as operating costs. Typically due monthly or annually.

opexonroute.label: On-Route Charging Tariff
opexonroute.help: Costs for charging vehicles on the road (not at depot) in EUR/kWh. Multiplied by the energy charged on the route. Typically includes charging costs at public charging stations.

opexfuel.label: Fuel Costs
opexfuel.help: Costs for diesel fuel in EUR/liter. Multiplied by the consumption of ICEV vehicles (Internal Combustion Engine Vehicles) and accounted as operating costs. Includes fuel price and potentially taxes.

weight_total.label: Permissible Gross Weight
weight_total.help: Permissible gross weight of vehicles in this subfleet in tons. Used for categorization and selection of appropriate vehicle types. Determines available mobility data and consumption values.

num_total.label: Vehicles Total
num_total.help: Total number of vehicles in this subfleet. Sum of existing and additional electric vehicles plus ICEV vehicles. Determines the total fleet size and energy demand.

num_bev_existing.label: Existing Electric Vehicles
num_bev_existing.help: Number of existing battery electric vehicles (BEV) in the baseline scenario. These vehicles are already in operation and are considered in both scenarios.

num_bev_expansion.label: Additional Electric Vehicles
num_bev_expansion.help: Number of additional BEV added to the fleet in the expansion scenario. Total BEV count in expansion scenario is: existing + additional. These vehicles typically replace ICEV vehicles.

charger.label: Charger
charger.help: Type of charging point used by vehicles in this subfleet (e.g., AC, DC). Determines the maximum charging power and available charging points. Each vehicle type can only charge with compatible charging points.

pwr_max.label: max. Charging Power
pwr_max.help: Maximum charging power of vehicles in this subfleet in kW. Actual charging power is the minimum of vehicle and charging point power. Determines charging duration and energy demand.

capex.label: Purchase Price
capex.help: Purchase cost of a single vehicle in EUR. Separate values for BEV and ICEV. Multiplied by the number of vehicles and replacement cycles. Replacement cycles account for vehicle lifetime.

share_toll.label: Share of Toll Roads
share_toll.help: Share of distance traveled on toll roads (0-100%). Multiplied by toll costs per km. Affects fleet operating costs.

type.label: Type
type.help: Static: Fixed maximum power limit for fleet charging (in kW). Dynamic: Power is automatically adjusted to available generation (PV, ESS, Grid). Dynamic load management optimizes the use of renewable energy.

pwr_max.label: max. Power
pwr_max.help: Maximum total power for fleet charging in kW (only for static load management). Limits the simultaneous charging power of all vehicles at the site. Prevents peak loads and can reduce grid connection costs.

existing.label: Existing
existing.help: Number of existing charging points of this type in the baseline scenario. Determines how many vehicles can charge simultaneously. More charging points enable parallel charging of multiple vehicles.

expansion.label: Additional
expansion.help: Number of additional charging points of this type added in the expansion scenario. Increases simultaneous charging capacity at the site and enables charging of larger fleets.

pwr_max.label: max. Charging Power
pwr_max.help: Maximum charging power of a single charging point of this type in kW. Actual charging power is the minimum of vehicle and charging point power. Higher power enables shorter charging times.

capex.label: Cost per Charger
capex.help: Purchase cost for a single charging point of this type in EUR. Multiplied by the number of charging points and replacement cycles. Typically includes hardware, installation, and potentially grid connection.

costs.title: Costs
costs.help: Direct comparison of discounted total costs (TOTEX = CAPEX + OPEX) of both scenarios over the entire analysis period. Shows the absolute cost values for baseline and expansion. Lower values mean lower total costs.

emissions.title: CO₂ Emissions
emissions.help: Direct comparison of cumulative CO₂ emissions of both scenarios over the entire analysis period. Accounts for emissions from vehicle manufacturing (embodied energy), operation (fuel/electricity), and energy procurement. Lower values mean lower emissions.

self_consumption.title: Self Consumption Rate
self_consumption.help: Share of generated PV energy that is directly consumed at the site (not fed into the grid or curtailed). Higher values mean better utilization of PV generation and reduce dependence on the grid. Given in percent.

self_sufficiency.title: Self Sufficiency Rate
self_sufficiency.help: Share of energy demand (site + fleet) covered by own PV generation. Shows independence from the electricity grid. 100% means complete self-sufficiency. Given in percent and also accounts for storage usage.

home_charging.title: Home Charging
home_charging.help: Share of fleet energy charged at the depot (vs. on the road). Higher values mean less dependence on public charging stations and better utilization of depot infrastructure. Given in percent.
home_charging.axis: Share of Energy Charged at the Depot

title.label: Total costs
title.help: Temporal progression of cumulative, discounted total costs (TOTEX = CAPEX + OPEX) for both scenarios over the analysis period. The difference between the curves shows the economic advantage of the expansion. Steeper curves mean higher costs.

paybackperiod.title: Payback Period
paybackperiod.help: Point in time in years when the additional investments of the expansion are balanced by cost savings. Calculated as the intersection of cumulative cost curves. Shorter payback period means faster return on investment.

saving.title: Cost Reduction
saving.help: Total cost savings (NPC difference) of the expansion compared to the baseline over the entire analysis period. Positive values mean the expansion is economically advantageous (lower total costs). Negative values indicate higher total costs in the expansion.

title.label: CO₂ Emissions
title.help: Temporal progression of cumulative CO₂ emissions for both scenarios over the analysis period. Accounts for emissions from vehicle manufacturing (embodied energy), operation (fuel/electricity), and energy procurement. The difference between the curves shows the CO₂ savings of the expansion.

paybackperiod.title: CO₂ Payback Period
paybackperiod.help: Point in time in years when the additional CO₂ emissions of the expansion (e.g., from vehicle manufacturing) are balanced by operational savings. Calculated as the intersection of cumulative emission curves. Shorter payback period means faster CO₂ neutrality.

saving.title: CO₂ Reduction
saving.help: Total CO₂ savings of the expansion compared to the baseline over the entire analysis period in tons of CO₂ equivalent. Positive values mean a reduction in emissions. Negative values indicate higher emissions in the expansion (e.g., from additional vehicle manufacturing).

empty.manual1:
Model your site and fleet as well as the planned expansion of your infrastructure in the sidebar  
Next, click on
empty.manual2: , to analyse the transformation of your site.

errors.grid:
**Grid Connection Error**  
**The grid connection cannot provide the required power**  
-> Occurring peak loads can be met by a larger grid connection or by using a PV system and stationary storage.  
  
Internal Error:
errors.soc:
**Charge Level Error**  
**The charge level of a vehicle is insufficient for the intended tour.**  
-> This can be solved by increasing the charging power (minimum of vehicle and charger power), increasing the number of chargers, or using a larger grid connection..  
  
Internal Error:
errors.undefined:
**Computation Error**  
Please contact the tool's administrators. Please provide the parameters used and the  
error message displayed below.  
  
Internal Error:

footer.institute: Institute of Automotive Technology, Technical University of Munich
